column4: I updated my video card drivers now when I start ubuntu it is completely black, how do I fix this???
boot to safemode, then ..
sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf  /etc/X11/xorg_broken  then sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
: at grub, press esc, choose recoverymode
: did you get it ?
: netroot or root,  scroll down the options
: after it told you it overwrote xorg,  , sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
: humm, strange , then back in safemode: nano /etc/X11/xorg  , blank all lines, try to start with empty xorg
: (ctrl-o stores emptyfile, ctrl-x leaves nano
sure, typo, sorry
or remove-purge it
was it a deb ? nvidia-sh ?
on your own risk, as its broken right now anyway, try envyng
what kind of screen are you using ?
try to reconfigure again
heh... safemode , then sudo dpkg-reconfigure -a
got it back ?
this issue occured on using system's hardwaredriver ?
I would try the nvidia-sh (latest) again, before install build essential, then do : sudo init 1 and install from there
sudo apt-get install build-essential linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r`
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get uprade, then try nvid-sh from safemode (init 1) again
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
can you find a choice under system > hardwaredrivers ?
ah, now restart x
